Is it this one you're looking for <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/api/crm/associations/associations-v4> ?

But you are right, the link to the guide on this page is indeed broken <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/reference/api/crm/associations/association-details>

Using this endpoint, I am getting some cors policy block related error in console. Have you implemented the same functionality if so can you please share code or workaround ? 
I'll be grateful for same.
Thanks
Good catch! This is one of my most looked at guide.

:orange_heart:*Please take a moment to review our Code of Conduct*:orange_heart:

We want the HubSpot Developer community to be inclusive and welcoming. By following our Code of Conduct, you can help ensure that's the case.

TL;DR:
• Be respectful
• Be inclusive (try not to say, "Hey guys, hey boys, hey [any specific group]")
• No self promotion, except for <#C0121KGC6RM|showcase> and <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs> 
• No unsolicited DMs
Read the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/slack/code-of-conduct|whole thing here> - and thanks for being a part of the HubSpot Developer Community!

Want to report a violation? DM <@UQNEXHW14> or fill out the <https://form.asana.com/?k=p7aM0fpd3G4JGETDL_nYXg&d=8587152060687|anonymous form here>.

I have a strange thing going on -- I'm looping over a bunch of videos in HubDB -- to print them out on a resources page here: <https://www.mid-southnightlights.com/video-gallery?hsCacheBuster=819>

Issue is -- the thumbnails are coming in "Black" even though they have thumbnails set on the video --
anyone experience this?? Know how to resolve this issue??
Here is a screenGrab of the HubDB table -- with all the thumbNails baked in ....

Hey Everyone! Im new to HubSpot and have a use-case I wanted to discuss:

*Context*:
We have a website that sells online products and based on user interactions with our website (signups, purchases, product usages, etc) we segment them into different buckets. These interactions are essentially Kafka events that are consumed and further processed based on our business logic (segmentation, cross-sell, etc)

Now, we use these segments to do a lot of cool stuff, one of which is to create marketing campaigns and then send out email communication. And we are hoping to integrate HubSpot for this purpose.

*Question*:
Is it wiser to import all our segment information into HubSpot and then create marketing campaigns there?
-OR-
Is there are way to import Kafka events directly into HubSpot and create segments and then campaigns there?
